result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

4:44 PM Defendant Shane A Hall appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Shane A Hall.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty McClure requests a competency hearing for his reasons stated on the record but has not met w/client yet. Court needs atty to meet w/client. Atty McClure can request competency eval in writing to the judge so an order can be prepared if needed.

2:08 PM Defendant Shane A Hall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq appeared by phone for Shane A Hall.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Given complaint/waived reading-Bond set. Defense raises mental issues of deft. State notes that Detective Olsen did not believe there were any issues with the deft. comprehending. State is not aware if there is a guardian or not. Court is referring the matter to the circuit court to determine if a competency evaluation is needed.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
